meanings.definition: The art or practice of garden cultivation and management.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother enjoys learning about horticulture in her gardening class.
meanings.sent2: Horticulture is an important skill for anyone who wants to grow their own vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The horticulture club at school had a competition to see who could grow the biggest pumpkin.
meanings.sent4: In the world of horticulture, each plant is like a unique work of art waiting to be created.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of horticulture lies in the harmony between nature and human creativity.

meanings.definition: The cultivation of a garden or orchard.
meanings.sent1: The horticulture of the community garden provides fresh produce for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: She studied horticulture to learn how to care for her apple orchard.
meanings.sent3: The horticulture of the backyard garden was so successful that they had an abundance of tomatoes.
meanings.sent4: The horticulture of the park's rose garden was so exquisite, it attracted visitors from far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The horticulture of the botanical garden showcased a stunning array of flowers and plants.
